description.en:
Created in 1958 and modernised in 1998 under a convention between the Institut National des Sciences de l’Univers (INSU) and the University of Addis Ababa. Now operated by the Institute of Geophysics, Space Science and Astronomy (IGSSA). A 17-kilometre light train line opened on 20 September 2015. Large distubances are, since then, present on recordings
Geomagnetic data :
Orientation : HDZF
Data Availability : 1 second data and derived means, Quasi definitive (2 months latency),definitive (1 year latency)
(see more information to http://www.bcmt.fr/aae.html)

description.en:

Orientation : HDZF
Data Availability : 1 second data and derived means, definitive

Orientation : HDZF
Data Availability : 1 second data and derived means, definitive

description.en:
From the 1st of January 1901, the new observatory in Val-Joyeux becomes the French National Magnetic Observatory.
In 1936, the Val-Joyeux Observatory will cease observations with the arrival of electric tramways, the development of power lines and industry in the Paris region.
Geomagnetic data :
Orientation : HDZ
Data Availability : Hourly and derived means
(see more information to http://www.bcmt.fr/vlj.html)
